title: Assessment Results
subtitle: Thank you for completing the MSK Pain Navigator

userInfo.title: Your Information
userInfo.name: Name
userInfo.analysisText: We have analyzed your responses regarding {{painArea}} pain.

descriptions.nociceptive: Your pain appears to be primarily nociceptive, which means it comes from damage or inflammation of tissues like muscles, ligaments or joints.
descriptions.neuropathic: Your pain appears to be primarily neuropathic, which means it is caused by nerve damage or dysfunction.
descriptions.central: Your pain appears to involve central sensitization, which means your nervous system has become hypersensitive to pain signals.

sinGroup.title: Pain Sensitivity Level
sinGroup.high: High Severity, High Irritability, High Nature

descriptions.high: Your pain has high severity, is easily triggered, and tends to be intense and long-lasting.
descriptions.mid: Your pain has moderate severity, moderate irritability, and moderate persistence.
descriptions.low: Your pain has low severity, is not easily triggered, and tends to be less intense.

descriptions.muscleStrain: Muscle strain is often caused by overexertion, poor posture, or sudden movements.
descriptions.svalovalBolesť: Muscle pain is often caused by overexertion, stretching, or inflammation of muscle tissues.
descriptions.cervicalRadiculopathy: Cervical radiculopathy is often caused by nerve compression or inflammation in the cervical spine area.

exercisePlan.title: Your Personalized Exercise Plan
exercisePlan.description: Based on your assessment, we have prepared a personalized exercise program specifically designed for your condition. Please note that this program should not replace professional medical care. For a complete diagnosis and treatment plan, please consult with a healthcare professional.
exercisePlan.savedNote: Results have been automatically saved. You can find them in the My Exercises section.

footer.disclaimer: This assessment does not replace professional medical care. For a complete diagnosis and treatment plan, please consult with a healthcare professional.

savedDescription: Your assessment has been successfully saved and can be found in the My Exercises section.
autoSaved: ✓ Results have been automatically saved. You can find them in the My Exercises section.
